snippet: The decision by clerks to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples has added a sense of urgency to a fight that some state’s leaders had seemed in no hurry to join.
abstract: Decision by clerks in six of New Mexico's most populous counties to start issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples adds sense of urgency to fight that some state's leaders seem in no hurry to join; New Mexico is the only state in the country that has no statute or constitutional amendment explicitly barring same-sex couples from marrying, but also has no law saying they can.

byline.original: By FERNANDA SANTOS and HEATH HAUSSAMEN
byline.contributor: Fernanda Santos reported from Albuquerque, and Heath Haussamen from Las Cruces, N.M.

lead_paragraph: The decision by clerks to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples has added a sense of urgency to a fight that some state’s leaders had seemed in no hurry to join.

headline.main: Marriage Licenses for Same-Sex Couples Force Issue to Fore in New Mexico
headline.print_headline: Marriage Licenses for Same-Sex Couples Force Issue to Fore in New Mexico

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
